bartMachine

Class bartMachineRegressionMultThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • bartMachine.Classifier
      • bartMachine.bartMachineRegressionMultThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    bartMachineClassificationMultThread

    public class bartMachineRegressionMultThread
extends Classifier
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class handles the parallelization of many Gibbs chains over many CPU cores to create one BART regression model. It also handles all operations on the completed model.
    Author:
    Adam Kapelner and Justin Bleich
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class bartMachine.Classifier

      bartMachineRegressionMultThread()
      the default constructor sets the number of total iterations each Gibbs chain is charged with sampling

    • Method Detail

      • setNumGibbsTotalIterations

        public void setNumGibbsTotalIterations(int num_gibbs_total_iterations)
        This is a simple setter for the number of total Gibbs samples and it also sets the total iterations per Gibbs chain running on each CPU core (see formula in the code)
        Parameters:
        num_gibbs_total_iterations - The number of total Gibbs iterations to set

      • numSamplesAfterBurning

        public int numSamplesAfterBurning()
        The number of samples after burning is simply the title minus the burn-in

        public boolean[][] getAcceptRejectMHsBurnin()
        Returns a record of Metropolis-Hastings acceptances or rejections for all trees during burn-in
        Returns:
        Yes/No's for acceptances for all Gibbs samples further indexed by tree

      • getAcceptRejectMHsAfterBurnIn

        public boolean[][] getAcceptRejectMHsAfterBurnIn(int thread_num)
        Returns a record of Metropolis-Hastings acceptances or rejections for all trees after burn-in
        Parameters:
        thread_num - Which CPU core's acceptance / rejection record should be returned
        Returns:
        Yes/No's for acceptances for all Gibbs samples further indexed by tree

      • getCountsForAllAttribute

        public int[][] getCountsForAllAttribute(java.lang.String type)
        Return the number of times each of the attributes were used during the construction of the sum-of-trees by Gibbs sample.
        Parameters:
        type - Either "splits" or "trees" ("splits" means total number and "trees" means sum of binary values of whether or not it has appeared in the tree)
        Returns:
        The counts for all Gibbs samples further indexed by the attribute 1, ..., p

      • getAttributeProps

        public double[] getAttributeProps(java.lang.String type)
        Return the proportion of times each of the attributes were used (count over total number of splits) during the construction of the sum-of-trees by Gibbs sample.
        Parameters:
        type - Either "splits" or "trees" ("splits" means total number and "trees" means sum of binary values of whether or not it has appeared in the tree)
        Returns:
        The proportion of splits for all Gibbs samples further indexed by the attribute 1, ..., p

      • getInteractionCounts

        public int[][] getInteractionCounts()
        For all Gibbs samples after burn in, calculate the set of interaction counts (consider a split on x_j and a daughter node splits on x_k and that would be considered an "interaction")
        Returns:
        A matrix of size p x p where the row is top split and the column is a bottom split. It is recommended to triangularize the matrix after ignoring the order.

      • Evaluate

        public double Evaluate(double[] record)
        The default BART evaluation of a new observations is done via sample average of the posterior predictions. Other functions can be used here such as median, mode, etc. Default is to use one CPU core.
        Overrides:
        Evaluate in class Classifier
        Parameters:
        record - The observation to be evaluated / predicted
        Returns:
        The prediction

      • Evaluate

        public double Evaluate(double[] record,
              int num_cores_evaluate)
        The default BART evaluation of a new observations is done via sample average of the posterior predictions. Other functions can be used here such as median, mode, etc.
        Specified by:
        Evaluate in class Classifier
        Parameters:
        record - The observation to be evaluated / predicted
        num_cores_evaluate - The number of CPU cores to use during evaluation
        Returns:
        The prediction

      • getDepthsForTreesInGibbsSampAfterBurnIn

        public int[][] getDepthsForTreesInGibbsSampAfterBurnIn(int thread_num)
        After burn in, find the depth (greatest generation of a terminal node) of each tree for each Gibbs sample
        Parameters:
        thread_num - which CPU core (which Gibbs chain) to return results for
        Returns:
        for each Gibbs chain return a vector of depths for all num_trees chains

      • getNumNodesAndLeavesForTreesInGibbsSampAfterBurnIn

        public int[][] getNumNodesAndLeavesForTreesInGibbsSampAfterBurnIn(int thread_num)
        After burn in, return the number of total nodes (internal plus terminal) of each tree for each Gibbs sample
        Parameters:
        thread_num - which CPU core (which Gibbs chain) to return results for
        Returns:
        for each Gibbs chain return a vector of number of nodes for all num_trees chains
